text: Modular system of shaders for building physically-based material networks in MaterialX.

Lama MaterialX has begun to appear in MaterialX, but the open source implementation is not complete. The nodes have been hidden, to avoid confusion about expectations and workflow. Once the definitions are more complete, Lama support will be announced.
is a modular system of shaders developed at Industrial Light & Magic, for building physically-based material networks in MaterialX.
There are many nodes and features not yet implemented in the open source MaterialX project. This is noticeable whe compared Lama MaterialX to the Lama nodes in
. Houdini and Karma will incorporate updates and changes as they appear in the Github repository.
Lama Bxdfs and non-Lama MaterialX Bxdfs are generally interchangable, but it’s recommended artists stick to the Lama palette of nodes wherever possible.
Karma Hair uses the same Chiang hair model as Lama Chiang in Renderman.
MaterialX Surface or MaterialX Thin Surface serve the function of Lama Surface for now.
This node adds two materials together. Each material has its own weight, to control how much of each material is added to the other. It can add two BSDFs or two EDFs.
If the combined weights are more that 1.0, your material is probably not conserving energy. This can be seen in noisy renders or very bright reflections.
